tags.name: Elasticpoollogs
tags.description: Controller to handle organization/collection level elastic pool logs operations

tags.name: Elasticpools
tags.description: Controller to handle organization/collection level elastic pool operations

tags.name: Nodes
tags.description: Controller to handle organization/collection level elastic node operations

post.description: Create a new elastic pool. This will create a new TaskAgentPool at the organization level. If a project id is provided, this will create a new TaskAgentQueue in the specified project.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Elastic pool to create. Contains the properties necessary for configuring a new ElasticPool.

parameters.name: poolName
parameters.description: Name to use for the new TaskAgentPool

parameters.name: authorizeAllPipelines
parameters.description: Setting to determine if all pipelines are authorized to use this TaskAgentPool by default.

parameters.name: autoProvisionProjectPools
parameters.description: Setting to automatically provision TaskAgentQueues in every project for the new pool.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Optional: If provided, a new TaskAgentQueue will be created in the specified project.

get.description: Get a list of all Elastic Pools.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

get.description: Returns the Elastic Pool with the specified Pool Id.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: poolId
parameters.description: Pool Id of the associated TaskAgentPool

patch.description: Update settings on a specified Elastic Pool.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

get.description: Get elastic pool diagnostics logs for a specified Elastic Pool.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: poolId
parameters.description: Pool Id of the Elastic Pool

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of elastic pool logs to retrieve

get.description: Get a list of ElasticNodes currently in the ElasticPool

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: $state
parameters.description: Optional: Filter to only retrieve ElasticNodes in the given ElasticNodeState

patch.description: Update properties on a specified ElasticNode

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

ElasticNode.description: Data and settings for an elastic node

agentState.description: Summary of the state of the agent

desiredState.description: Users can force state changes to specific states (ToReimage, ToDelete, Save)

id.description: Unique identifier since the agent and/or VM may be null

name.description: Computer name. Used to match a scaleset VM with an agent

poolId.description: Pool Id that this node belongs to

requestId.description: Last job RequestId assigned to this agent

stateChangedOn.description: Last state change. Only updated by SQL.

ElasticNodeSettings.description: Class used for updating an elastic node where only certain members are populated

ElasticPool.description: Data and settings for an elastic pool

agentInteractiveUI.description: Set whether agents should be configured to run with interactive UI

azureId.description: Azure string representing to location of the resource

desiredIdle.description: Number of agents to have ready waiting for jobs

desiredSize.description: The desired size of the pool

maxCapacity.description: Maximum number of nodes that will exist in the elastic pool

maxSavedNodeCount.description: Keep nodes in the pool on failure for investigation

offlineSince.description: Timestamp the pool was first detected to be offline

orchestrationType.description: Operating system type of the nodes in the pool

osType.description: Operating system type of the nodes in the pool

recycleAfterEachUse.description: Discard node after each job completes

serviceEndpointId.description: Id of the Service Endpoint used to connect to Azure

serviceEndpointScope.description: Scope the Service Endpoint belongs to

sizingAttempts.description: The number of sizing attempts executed while trying to achieve a desired size

timeToLiveMinutes.description: The minimum time in minutes to keep idle agents alive

ElasticPoolCreationResult.description: Returned result from creating a new elastic pool

ElasticPoolLog.description: Log data for an Elastic Pool

operation.description: Operation that triggered the message being logged

ElasticPoolSettings.description: Class used for updating an elastic pool where only certain members are populated

agentInteractiveUI.description: Set whether agents should be configured to run with interactive UI

azureId.description: Azure string representing to location of the resource

desiredIdle.description: Number of machines to have ready waiting for jobs

maxCapacity.description: Maximum number of machines that will exist in the elastic pool

maxSavedNodeCount.description: Keep machines in the pool on failure for investigation

orchestrationType.description: Operating system type of the machines in the pool

osType.description: Operating system type of the machines in the pool

recycleAfterEachUse.description: Discard machines after each job completes

serviceEndpointId.description: Id of the Service Endpoint used to connect to Azure

serviceEndpointScope.description: Scope the Service Endpoint belongs to

timeToLiveMinutes.description: The minimum time in minutes to keep idle agents alive

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

PropertiesCollection.description: The class represents a property bag as a collection of key-value pairs. Values of all primitive types (any type with a `TypeCode != TypeCode.Object`) except for `DBNull` are accepted. Values of type Byte[], Int32, Double, DateType and String preserve their type, other primitives are retuned as a String. Byte[] expected as base64 encoded string.

count.description: The count of properties in the collection.

keys.description: The set of keys in the collection.

values.description: The set of values in the collection.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

agentCloudId.description: The ID of the associated agent cloud.

autoProvision.description: Whether or not a queue should be automatically provisioned for each project collection.

autoSize.description: Whether or not the pool should autosize itself based on the Agent Cloud Provider settings.

autoUpdate.description: Whether or not agents in this pool are allowed to automatically update

createdBy.description: Creator of the pool. The creator of the pool is automatically added into the administrators group for the pool on creation.

createdOn.description: The date/time of the pool creation.

owner.description: Owner or administrator of the pool.

targetSize.description: Target parallelism - Only applies to agent pools that are backed by pool providers. It will be null for regular pools.

isHosted.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not this pool is managed by the service.

isLegacy.description: Determines whether the pool is legacy.

values.description: TaskAgentPool backed by the Elastic pool service
Set to true if agents are re-imaged after each TaskAgentJobRequest
Set to true if agents are held for investigation after a TaskAgentJobRequest failure

poolType.description: Gets or sets the type of the pool

values.description: A typical pool of task agents

size.description: Gets the current size of the pool.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.agentpools_manage: Grants the ability to manage pools, queues, and agents
scopes.vso.agentpools: Grants the ability to view tasks, pools, queues, agents, and currently running or recently completed jobs for agents
